title: Graph of Function - Exponential vs Quadratic

content.description:
The figure is labeled Graph of f.

The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 8 in increments of 2. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 8 in increments of 2.

All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 4.5 comma 0.2).

The curve increases at a greater and greater rate.

The curve passes through the following points:

(0 comma 1.2),

(2 comma 2),

(4 comma 4),

and (6 comma 8).

The curve exits the window at (6.2 comma 8.6).

The figure shows a portion of the graph of a function <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following conclusions is possible for <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is a quadratic function because the output values are proportional over equal-length input-value intervals.
<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is a quadratic function because the average rates of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals can be given by a linear function.
<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is an exponential function because the output values are proportional over equal-length input-value intervals.
<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is an exponential function because the average rates of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals can be given by a linear function.

content.answer: <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is an exponential function because the output values are proportional over equal-length input-value intervals.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
